contentrichtext.text: {{about|the jurist|the ballet dancer|Alexander Volchkov (dancer)|the ice hockey player|Alexander Volchkov (ice hockey)}} {{unref|date=November 2012}} [[File:Russian judges at Nuremberg.jpg|right|thumbnail|250px|Russian judges at Nuremberg, left to right: Alexander Volchkov, [[Iona Nikitchenko]]. British judge, [[William Norman Birkett, 1st Baron Birkett|Norman Birkett]] sat at extreme right.]] Lieutenant Colonel '''Alexander Fedorovich Volchkov''' (Russian: Алекса́ндр Фёдорович Волчко́в; 1902-1978) was a [[judge]] during the [[Nuremberg Trials]] after [[World War II]]. He was the alternate [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] judge during the proceedings. Before taking up the practice of law he had worked in the film business. {{Nuremberg Trial judges|Volchkov, Alexander Fedorovich}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Volchkov, Alexander Fedorovich | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian judge | DATE OF BIRTH = 1902 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1978 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Volchkov, Alexander Fedorovich}} [[Category:Russian judges]] [[Category:Soviet jurists]] [[Category:1902 births]] [[Category:1978 deaths]] {{Russia-law-bio-stub}}
